title: Provenance flags and deny-by-default posture (scaffold)
summary: Summit IO records provenance risk indicators for high-velocity domains and cross-posted assets, enforcing deny-by-default until corroborated.
findings: High-volume domain networks and rapid asset reuse are treated as untrusted until corroborated by allowlisted sources.
Provenance scoring will rely on registry and asset-hash overlap once ingestion is operational.
limitations: Automated provenance scoring is Intentionally constrained to deny-by-default until ingestion coverage is expanded.
